artist: Artist: Fukumoto Shigeki; Translator: Meredith McKinney
description: small book with purple and blue resist-dyed fabric cover; pages pierced and bound with blue string; fern design on cover with lettering; contains an ink on paper design and a page with a cloth inlay collage square toward front of book; contains printed essays in Japanese followed by an English translation; essay titled To Dye, Perchance to Dream: The Enchantments of Rozome
markings: resist-dyed in fabric cover: DRAFTBOOK / BIBELOT / BIJOU BOOK / LILLIPUT EDITION; inside page, black ink on paper: SHREDDED MESSAGE / [Japanese writing] / FUKUMOTO SHIGEKI
medium: Rozome, cloth inlay, washi paper, fiber reactive dye, cotton thread, ink on paper
signed: back page, graphite: Shigeki 2011 / [red chop mark]
title: Hime-hon: Collected Essays
